thread.title: Exclusive ticket offer: catch Take That in concert with England rugby
thread.title_full: Exclusive ticket offer: catch Take That in concert with England rugby - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Exclusive ticket offer: catch Take That in concert with England rugby
text: The power of support is central to England’s hopes of success, and fans can show they are right behind the Team by being at Wear the Rose Live, a unique evening of live entertainment on Wednesday 9 September. Exclusive Telegraph offer Get a 2015 England replica shirt – free. 1,000 Telegraph readers can take advantage of this fantastic ticket offer: buy a £55 ticket to Wear the Rose Live and receive a free official new 2015 England Rugby replica shirt worth £65. Buy now using code THETELEGRAPH Among the acts lining up to play in front of the 14,500 audience are: The England Rugby squad – 31 players, plus coaches and management Global pop superstars Take That – playing an hour-long set, with a 48-piece orchestra for the first time 2014 Britain’s Got Talent Winner Collabro, who topped the album charts last year Laura Wright, England Rugby’s million-album-selling official anthem singer Kim Gavin, the creative director of the acclaimed London 2012 closing ceremony, takes over the artistic reins for Wear the Rose Live Vernon ‘Mr TV’ Kay keeps things moving along seamlessly as host as England captain Chris Robshaw and his players take part in live interviews Don't miss it! Offer closes at 23.59hrs on 31.08.15. 1000 tickets priced at £55 plus booking fees including a free England Rugby replica shirt available to Telegraph readers from axs.com/WTRtelegraph using the code THETELEGRAPH. Only one shirt can be claimed per £55 ticket. Shirt is non-transferable, no cash or credit alternative. Shirt sizes are limited. All shirt orders must be placed by 23.59hrs 09.09.15 telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
